attributes.action: ensure military widows or widowers retain their spouses pension if they chose to remarry
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The widows or widowers of any military personnel lose their portion of their spouse’s pension should they feel the need to fill their remaining lonely days by remarrying. This is not the case for bereaved MPs spouses who can remarry without penalty. So how can successive governments conveniently hide behind the so-called military covenant to which they clearly pay less than lip service?
I spent 28 years in the Royal Navy and whilst I love my wife very much, I do not wish her to spend her last years alone should I die first. Why should she lose the pension I have paid for to look after her in her old age? This fundamental inequality wants fixing now.
